title: Quiz 2: Bacteriology
description: Test your knowledge on bacterial shapes, structures (flagella, spores), growth phases, and sterilization methods.

questions.question: Match the bacterial morphology (shape) with its correct description:
questions.explanation: Cocci are spheres; Bacilli are rods; Vibrio is curved; Strepto- prefix indicates chains.
questions.hint: Strepto means chain; Staphylo means cluster.

questions.question: Which flagellar arrangement features a tuft of flagella at one end of the bacterium?

richContent.content:
Flagella Types:
Monotrichous (One)
Amphitrichous (Both ends)
Peritrichous (All over)
??? (Tuft at one end)

questions.explanation: Lophotrichous bacteria have a cluster or tuft of flagella at one pole.

questions.question: Order the phases of the bacterial growth curve chronologically:
questions.explanation: Bacteria adapt (Lag), divide rapidly (Log), stabilize (Stationary), and die off (Death).

questions.question: The time required for a bacterial population to double in number is called the ___BLANK___ time.
questions.explanation: Generation time (or doubling time) is the interval required for binary fission to double the population.
questions.hint: It relates to a new 'generation' of cells.

questions.question: Which of the following are physical methods used for sterilization? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Autoclaving, Incineration, and Filtration can sterilize. Alcohol is generally a disinfectant/antiseptic, not a sterilant for all spores.

questions.question: What is the specific group of bacteria that grow best at moderate temperatures (e.g., 37°C) and includes most human pathogens?
questions.explanation: Mesophiles grow in moderate temperatures (20-45°C), which includes human body temperature.

questions.question: Which type of bacteria specifically requires oxygen for aerobic respiration?
questions.explanation: Obligate aerobes essentially require oxygen to survive and grow.

questions.question: Pasteurization is a sterilization method that kills all microorganisms, including endospores.
questions.explanation: Pasteurization is mild heating to kill pathogens and spoilage organisms; it does NOT sterilize or kill all spores.
questions.hint: Does milk last forever on the shelf?

questions.question: Match the environmental factor with the bacterial group that loves it:
Which statement about bacterial reproduction is CORRECT?
questions.explanation: Bacteria reproduce asexually through binary fission, dividing into two equal progeny.
